msItem.note: This description is abbreviated from Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue (Oxford, 2018), pp. 1389–1398. For purposes of scholarly citation, reference to the printed catalogue is requested.

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Super epistolam Pauli ad Romanos
msItem.note: Extracts (ed.: PG 14. 1203A–62C; C. P. Hammond, ‘Notes on the manuscripts and editions of Origen’s Commentary on the Epistle to the Romans in the Latin translation by Rufinus’, JTS 16 (1965) 338–57, this copy at pp. 345 & 350, n. 2).

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: De paenitentia (serm. 393)
msItem.note: (ed.: PL 67. 1082B–83B, hom. 19; PL 39. 1713–15, serm. 393; = Caesarius of Arles?, serm. 63)

msItem.author: Aelred of Rievaulx
msItem.title: Sermones de oneribus
msItem.note: Excerpt from hom. 2. 2–16 (ed.: PL 195. 368A–70D (serm. 3); ed. G. Raciti, CCCM 2D (2005) 31–36; Stegmüller, RB, 942).

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: Ad inquisitiones Ianuarii (epp. 54–5)
msItem.note: Excerpt from ep. 54, 3 (ed.: PL 33. 201; ed. A. Goldbacher, CSEL 34/2 (1898) 162–163, l. 9; Hauréau, Initia, 2. 70vb; Römer ii/1. 234f.; CPL 262). See also MS. Laud Misc. 514, fols 86v–87r.

msItem.title: Flores ex libris Ambrosii
msItem.rubric: Incipiunt flores ex libris beati Ambrosii episcopi

msItem.author: Ambrose
msItem.title: Expositio de Psalmo CXVIII
msItem.note: Excerpts, in the range of serm. 1–22 (ed.: PL 15. 1199C–1521A; ed. M. Petschenig & M. Zelzer, CSEL 62, 5 (19992) 5–503; Stegmüller, RB, 1242; CPL 141).

msItem.author: Ambrose
msItem.title: Commentary on Luke
msItem.note: Excerpts, 1–10 (ed.: PL 15. 1539D–1846B; ed. K. Schenkel, CSEL 32, 4 (1902) 20–520; M. Adriaen, CCSL 14 (1957) 14–394; Stegmüller, RB, 1243; PLS 1. 569; CPL 143).

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: Enarrationes in Psalmos
msItem.note: Excerpts, in the range of En. 1–60 (ed.: PL 36. 67–728; ed. Stegmüller, RB, 1463, and suppl.; Römer ii/1. 367; ii/2. 279; CCPM 2. 1869a; CPL 283). See printed catalogue for listing of interpolations.
msItem.rubric: Incipiunt flores ex libris beati Augustini episcopi

msItem.author: Ps.-Hugh of Saint-Victor
msItem.title: Summa sententiarum
msItem.note: (R.-M. Martin, ‘L’oeuvre théologique de Robert de Melun’, Revue d’histoire ecclésiastique 15 (1914) 456–89, at p. 484, citing the present MS.; id., ‘La nécessité de croire au mystère de l’incarnation: témoignages et documents en partie inédits du xiie siècle’, Revue Thomiste, n. s. 3 (1920) 273–80, this copy at p. 277; L. Ott, Untersuchungen zur theologischen Briefliteratur der Frühscholastik unter besonderer Berücksichtigung des Viktorinerkreises, BGPTM 34 (1937) 535, citing the present MS.; cf. Stegmüller, RS, 745, citing the present MS.).

supportDesc.support: parchment; remnants of medieval repair (stitching, with plain thread). The fragment at the end (fol. 97) made of sheepskin.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruling (quires i & ii) in lead point and ink, one column of c.31-33 lines. Ruled space c.162–80 124–30
Ruling (quires iii–xii) in lead point or ink, one column of c.21–30 lines. Ruled space c.150–65 108–23

handDesc.handNote: late protogothic script verging on textualis, possibly German, s. xiiiin, by two main hands, with interruptions: 1) (fols 1r–16v); 2) (fols 17r–54v, l. 13; 55r, l. 11–96v). Numerous marginalia, mostly in the text hands, less frequently in other, contemporary, hands.

decoDesc.decoNote: Coloured initials in red, sometimes moderately decorated.

binding.p: Brown tanned calf over laminated pulpboard for Archbp. Laud, 1637–1639

history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: the 15th-cent. ex-libris inscriptions at the upper right-hand margin of fol. 1r: ‘Liber Carthusiensium maguncie’ and, possibly in the same hand, at the upper margin of fol. 96v: ‘Iste liber est Cartusiensium prope magunciam’. Identifiable as F XXV T in cat. ii.
William Laud, 1573–1645: Ex-libris inscription of Archbp. Laud, dated 1638, at the lower margin of fol. 1r.
history.acquisition: Given to the Bodleian as part of his third donation, dispatched on 28 June 1639.

recordHist.source: See above. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Quarto Catalogue, col. 377 Quarto Catalogue, p. 568 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 50

listBibl.head: Published descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue, 2 vols. (Oxford, 2018), pp. 1389–1398

msItem.title: Missal (?)
msItem.note: Fragment: part of a leaf from a Missal (?) (fer. 2 post dncam in palmis).

supportDesc.extent: part of a leaf (25 lines of text preserved)

revisionDesc.change: Description revised for Mainz digitization project to include additional information from Mairhofer catalogue.
